question.text: The flocculation value of  <math><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi></math>  for arsenic sulphide sol. is 30 m mol  <math><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">L</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>–</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mo>.</mo></math>  If  <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>S</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></math>  is used for the flocculation of arsenic sulphide, the amount, in grams, of  <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>S</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></math>  in 250 ml required for the above purpose is (molecular mass of  <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>98</mn><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi></mrow><mo>/</mo><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">o</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi></mrow></mrow></math> )

solution.text:
→ 1 litre solution of 30 m mol of HCl is required

→ For 1 litre solution 15 m mol H2SO4 is required.

250 ml of solution required: 154×10-3 (m mol) of H2SO4

=0.3675 gm
